SEARCH
Package Interface.consensus

Interface ApproximateConsensusHandler<ConsensusAttachment>

Type Parameters:
ConsensusAttachment - Type of the attachment that can be fed to the handler to provide additional information needed for the algorithm's exectution.
public interface ApproximateConsensusHandler<ConsensusAttachment>
Handler for performing the necessary steps at certain points in an approximate consensus algorithm's execution. An implementation of this interface may be stateful, but only for a single instance of consensus. State is not kept from instance to instance. Each method has a default implementation that implements the corresponding steps in the SynchDLPSW86 algorithm.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type

    default double
    approximationRound(ConsensusState cs, double[] V, double v, int round, ConsensusAttachment ca)
    Handler to perform the reduction on the multiset of votes received on a certain round, corresponding to the MSR phase in many approximate consensus algorithms.

    Handler to check if enough messages have been received from other processes on a given round.

  • Method Details

    • onNewConsensus

      default Double onNewConsensus(ConsensusState cs, Double latestVote, ConsensusAttachment ca)
      Handler to perform a transformation on the previously cast vote when new consensus is called by another process.
      Parameters:
      cs - Object containing the state of the consensus algorithm's execution.
      latestVote - The last vote the process has cast.
      ca - The object attached to the instance of consensus when it was initiated.
      Returns:
      The vote that will be used in this instance of consensus.

    • rounds

      default int rounds(ConsensusState cs, double[] V0, ConsensusAttachment ca)
      Handler to determine the number of rounds necessary to achieve approximate consensus based on the initial votes collected in the first round.
      Parameters:
      cs - Object containing the state of the consensus algorithm's execution.
      V0 - The multiset of votes at the initialization round, as a list.
      ca - The object attached to the instance of consensus when it was initiated.
      Returns:
      The number of rounds necessary to achieve consensus.

    • onReceive

      default Double onReceive(ConsensusState cs, ApproximationMessage msg, ConsensusAttachment ca)
      Handler to perform a transformation on a vote received from another process.
      Parameters:
      cs - Object containing the state of the consensus algorithm's execution.
      msg - The message received from another process, containing their vote.
      ca - The object attached to the instance of consensus when it was initiated.
      Returns:
      The process's vote, transformed.

    • approximationRound

      default double approximationRound(ConsensusState cs, double[] V, double v, int round, ConsensusAttachment ca)
      Handler to perform the reduction on the multiset of votes received on a certain round, corresponding to the MSR phase in many approximate consensus algorithms.
      Parameters:
      cs - Object containing the state of the consensus algorithm's execution.
      V - The multiset of votes received in this round, including the process's own.
      v - The process's own approximation from the previous round.
      round - The round of approximation.
      ca - The object attached to the instance of consensus when it was initiated.
      Returns:
      The next approximation.

    • endExchangeCondition

      default boolean endExchangeCondition(ConsensusState cs, double[] multiset, int round, ConsensusAttachment ca)
      Handler to check if enough messages have been received from other processes on a given round.
      Parameters:
      cs - Object containing the state of the consensus algorithm's execution.
      multiset - The multiset of votes received thus far, excluding the calling process's own, as a list.
      round - The relevant round.
      ca - The object attached to the instance of consensus when it was initiated.
      Returns:
      True if no more messages are needed for this round, false otherwise.
